ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] The Beastlord
ygData.msgSnippet: You are perfectly correct. In the normal exp group however fighting blue mobs at level60 the Beastlord outtanks the Ranger with similar level and Equip. This
ygData.messageBody:
You are perfectly correct.

In the normal exp group however fighting blue mobs at level60 the Beastlord
outtanks the Ranger with similar level and Equip. This was the scenario I
was referring to. Not having a Ranger or Beastlord trying to tank AoW that
hits for 1150 flurry unslowed. The ranger in that scenario would only tank
for 18 secs with Ws to cushion the tankswitch the way I see it.

That was what I meant.



-----Original Message-----
From: LAINE. Mikael (Nol) [mailto:laine@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 30, 2002 3:20 PM
To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: SV: [EverQuest] The Beastlord


Ok let's do it like this.

Nor highend ranger or highend beastlord will do well in a high end
encounter.

Nor normal_ranger_1 or normal_beastlord_1 will tank well at all =P

But i do admit that rangers kicks at high end, never seen a high end
beastlord tho.

-----Ursprungligt meddelande-----
Från: alexander.jones@...
[mailto:alexander.jones@...]
Skickat: den 30 juli 2002 15:26
Till: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Ämne: RE: [EverQuest] The Beastlord


And yes i was comparing a similar leveled beastlord.


-----Original Message-----
From: LAINE. Mikael (Nol) [mailto:laine@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 30, 2002 3:12 PM
To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: SV: [EverQuest] The Beastlord


Well, compare them to your tanks and get back back to me. You can't compare
a high end char with anything else than another high end char.

-----Ursprungligt meddelande-----
Från: alexander.jones@...
[mailto:alexander.jones@...]
Skickat: den 30 juli 2002 15:12
Till: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Ämne: RE: [EverQuest] The Beastlord


Our rangers have about 1500ac (way over the cap) and 5000-5500hps buffed,
its all what you compare against.

-----Original Message-----
From: LAINE. Mikael (Nol) [mailto:laine@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 30, 2002 2:53 PM
To: 'EverQuest@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: SV: [EverQuest] The Beastlord


Yeah and we all know how well rangers tank =P

-----Ursprungligt meddelande-----
Från: alexander.jones@...
[mailto:alexander.jones@...]
Skickat: den 30 juli 2002 15:00
Till: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Ämne: RE: [EverQuest] The Beastlord


A monk also wears leather armor. And a monk tanks pretty good. Aside from
that the beastlord get a defensive discipline like the warrior. A beastlord
outtanks most rangers for example.


-----Original Message-----
From: Louis Gumaer [mailto:lgumaer@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 30, 2002 2:34 PM
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] The Beastlord


How could a beastlord tank well wearing leather armor? I don't think they
have that many hitpoints either and only get duel wield. Seems like a good
class to solo or partner with though if you aren't into raiding. You
basically get either two tanks or a tank and a healer depending on how you
play.

I heard they get a couple of group spells, one increases mana and life regen
and the other increases stats and resistances.
----- Original Message -----
From: alexander.jones@...
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, July 30, 2002 5:12 AM
Subject: RE: [EverQuest] The Beastlord


The beastlord is sadly untuned yet. As for pet beeing the tank in a group,
hmm nope. Pets cant tank shit if you have any other melee in group, the cant
hold aggro besides the fact that pathing can really screw things up.

The beastlord himself tanks pretty good and the petheals are excellent.
But the class brings very little to the raiding world and very few play them
